title: Failure to count DNTs in 2027 Census could alienate over 10 crore people: G.N. Devy
content: In an interview with The Hindu, the Chair of the government’s 2006 Technical Advisory Group on DNTs, says the problem of alienating these communities could become much bigger than the problem of enumerating them.

title: Pedalling for a greener tomorrow
content: Around 90 riders, including students and community members, participated in SAKSHAM 2025–26 Cyclothon with an aim to promote fuel conservation and sustainable living. The 13-km ride passed through key city areas before concluding at Shanghumughom.

title: Ailing Kuki-Zo MLA airlifted from Imphal to Delhi
content: Valte, who represents Thanlon Assembly constituency for the BJP, sustained grievous injuries during the May 2023 ethnic violence in Imphal and had been staying in Churachandpur following prolonged treatment in New Delhi

title: Sacrilege at Tirumala will not be tolerated: BJP State chief
content: Madhav flays erstwhile YSRCP regime for hurting Hindu sentiments and says those involved in alleged scam will be dealt with according to law

title: CPI(M) leader Brittas meets Uttarakhand gym owner Deepak, shopkeeper, after alleged right-wing harassment
content: The CPI(M) MP visited Kotdwar on February 8, to express solidarity with gym owner Deepak Kumar, who had stepped in to protect Muslim shopkeeper Vakil Ahmed during an alleged right-wing harassmentprotest over the name of his garment store

title: Police step up action against late night stunts, viral dance gatherings at Hi-Tec City
content: During the weekend special drive, 60 bikes, five cameras and a drone have been seized, and at least four cases have been registered.

title: Each Minister handles his responsibility, says Piyush Goyal on trade deal, Russian oil
content: Piyush Goyal also sought to address the concerns of the farmers unions as well, asserting that “not a single farmer had anything to worry about” as sensitive items have been excluded from the deal

title: March target set for Rajahmundry Airport commissioning
content: The terminal-2 is being built with Rs.350 crore to accommodate 2,100 passengers during the peak hours.

title: Call for tranquilised tiger’s rehabilitation in Andhra landscape grows louder
content: The big cat shouldn’t be confined to a cage any longer as its emotional response and behaviours tend to change due to exposure to ‘human footprint’, observe experts

title: No proposal for districts reorganisation before the government: CM Revanth Reddy
content: He categorically denied claims that the Bhupalpally district was being abolished, asserting that there was no such proposal before the government and added that the BRS was deliberately misleading the public by circulating rumours

title: Bird flu confirmed in two villages of Annamayya district in Andhra Pradesh
content: Department of Animal Husbandry deploys Rapid Response Teams, begins culling operations  in accordance with the Standard Operating Procedures; there is no need to panic, and consumption of properly cooked poultry meat and eggs is safe, it says

title: Moolapet temple to undergo ₹16.7 crore renovation
content: The temple will be readied and thrown open to the devotees in the next 18 months, say Ministers Ponguru Narayana and Anam Ramanarayana Reddy

title: 'Still 1.25 crore Hindus in Bangladesh': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat issues unity call
content: ​Bhagwat also spoke about the deepening concerns over the illegal infiltration in the country, which has continued unabated over the decades, saying: "We should inform the police that we suspect these people are foreigners, and they should investigate and keep an eye on them, and we will also keep an eye on them. We will not give employment to any foreigner."

title: Red Bird trainer aircraft 'runs out of fuel' & lands in field; both onboard safe
content: A Red Bird training aircraft made a forced landing near Vijayapura due to suspected fuel starvation, approximately 50-70 km before its destination in Belagavi. Both the flight instructor and student pilot on board the 1975-built Cessna 172 are safe, though the aircraft sustained damage. Aviation authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Japan snap elections: PM Sanae Takaichi’s LDP secures majority in lower house
content: Japan's ruling LDP, led by PM Sanae Takaichi, is poised for a significant win in snap elections, exit polls suggest. This victory could empower Takaichi to advance her conservative agenda, including increased defense spending. However, voter concerns about inflation and economic stability persist, alongside heightened regional tensions with China.

title: Placed alongside India and Pak, Namibia captain says there are 'no minnows' in T20
content: Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus spoke about the challenges of limited exposure, the growth of cricket back home, and why the tag of “Associate” no longer fits in T20 cricket. Namibia will start their campaign against the Netherlands at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi on Tuesday.

title: Jayalalithaa to EPS: The BJP-AIADMK on-off relationship
content: The BJP and AIADMK have rekindled their alliance for the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, marking another chapter in their cyclical relationship of partnership and rupture. Driven by political necessity, the alliance aims to challenge the incumbent Stalin-led DMK government, despite past tensions and strategic divergences between the two parties.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: ‘She nearly died’: Toddler returned to ICE custody, denied medication, lawsuit says
content: An 18-month-old girl, Amalia, was hospitalized with a life-threatening respiratory illness while detained by US immigration authorities. She was returned to custody and denied medication after her release from the hospital, amidst a measles outbreak at the Dilley, Texas facility. Her parents, also detained, sued for their release.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: Happy Chocolate Day 2026: Top 50 Wishes, Messages and Quotes
content: Chocolate Day 2026 arrives on February 9th. This Valentine's Week celebration offers a sweet way to express affection. The article provides over 50 wishes, messages, and quotes. These range from deeply romantic to humorous and are perfect for partners, friends, or long-distance loved ones. Famous quotes are also included for social media.

title: Kerala election: Why CPM, Congress and BJP are clashing over Jamaat-e-Islami
content: The latest round of exchanges was triggered after Congress leader and the leader of the opposition VD Satheesan indicated that the UDF would accept support from Jamaat-e-Islami, asserting that the organisation had clarified it does not advocate a religion-based nation in India. That remark drew immediate criticism from both the CPM and the BJP, who accused the Congress of legitimising a group they describe as communal.

title: YouTube TV is reportedly giving $20 monthly discount to select users for four months
content: Select YouTube TV users are reportedly receiving a four-month, $20 monthly discount, totaling $80 off, with eligibility appearing random. Users can check their subscription settings on a desktop browser for the offer. This follows previous credits issued during content blackouts, such as a $15 credit in 2022 and a $20 credit last year due to disputes with Disney.

title: Ex-Pak cricketer says Babar Azam may be dropped for next game
content: Babar Azam's position in Pakistan's T20 team is under scrutiny. A slow innings against the Netherlands has led to sharp criticism. Former player Basit Ali suggested Babar might be dropped for the next match. Concerns about his T20 suitability were highlighted by past Big Bash League struggles. Team management had previously indicated that reputation would not guarantee selection.

title: Super Bowl LX start times worldwide, date, venue, streaming and how to watch
content: Super Bowl LX is scheduled for Sunday, February 8, 2026, at Levi Stadium, featuring a rematch between the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks. The championship game will be broadcast across various platforms in the United States, United Kingdom, India, Brazil, and Mexico, with a star-studded halftime show featuring Bad Bunny.

title: 'Showed him wedding saree’: Bengaluru bodybuilder dies by suicide after girlfriend’s engagement
content: A 26-year-old gym trainer died by suicide after learning his girlfriend of three years was engaged to another man. He reportedly left a note blaming his lover and her mother for his death. Family members stated he was devastated by the news and had financially supported his girlfriend.

title: Lindsey Vonn injured in Cortina crash as Breezy Johnson wins Olympic gold
content: Lindsey Vonn crashed early in the Olympic women’s downhill in Cortina d’Ampezzo and was taken away by helicopter for medical checks. The race paused as fans waited in silence. After competition resumed, American Breezy Johnson won gold by a slim margin. Germany’s Emma Aicher took silver, while Italy’s Sofia Goggia earned bronze.

title: Super Bowl preview: Drake Maye vs Sam Darnold carry Patriots and Seahawks legacy
content: Drake Maye, at 23, could become the youngest Super Bowl-winning quarterback against Sam Darnold’s Seattle Seahawks. Maye’s pairing with head coach and former New England Patriots player Mike Vrabel could be the first step toward Tom Brady and Bill Belichick’s undefeatable dynasty. Meanwhile, Darnold reportedly seeks redemption, thoroughly aiming to overcome his “bust” label and secure a Super Bowl title with Seattle’s strong defense and his own gutsy performance. This Super Bowl LX chance for Seahawks comes after 12 long years.

title: Will TreVeyon Henderson play in Super Bowl LX vs Seahawks? Injury update
content: ​​The New England Patriots head into Super Bowl LX with cautious optimism surrounding running back TreVeyon Henderson, whose health has been under quiet watch following a midgame scare earlier in the postseason. The availability of Henderson is now more attached with the unit of a team and its backfield, since the team is about to play the championship match with Seattle Seahawks.

title: T20 WC: India cancel practice session in Delhi ahead of match against Namibia
content: India's cricket team has opted out of their optional training session in Delhi. This comes ahead of their second group match against Namibia. The team faced pressure in their opening game against USA. Captain Suryakumar Yadav's performance secured a win. Bowlers also played a crucial role in the victory.

title: After year of turmoil, Indian diamonds and gems set to shine in US markets
content: India and the US have agreed to an interim trade framework granting zero-duty access for diamonds and colored gemstones. This move is seen as a critical inflection point for the Indian gems and jewellery sector, aiming to reverse a significant decline in exports to the US market and restore competitiveness.

title: Trump removes 25% penal tariff: What are India's options if it stops buying Russian oil?
content: Indian refiners have not yet received any formal instructions to halt Russian crude imports, they have been informally advised to begin scaling back purchases.  Experts believe that while Russian crude may drop in the coming months, the chances of it completely disappearing from India’s crude basket appear slim.

title: ‘Bringing them to justice’: B'desh seeks UN help to probe killing of student leader Hadi
content: Bangladesh's interim government has formally requested UN human rights assistance for a fair probe into student leader Sharif Osman Hadi's killing. Hadi, a prominent protest figure, died after being shot during an election event. Dhaka police filed charges against 17, alleging political vengeance linked to the Awami League, a claim Hadi's party disputes, citing state agency involvement.

title: T20 World Cup: England survive Nepal scare; register 4-run win in last over thriller
content: England narrowly defeated Nepal by four runs in their T20 World Cup opener at the Wankhede Stadium. Despite a valiant chase from Nepal, who needed ten runs in the final over, England's Sam Curran held his nerve. Earlier, half-centuries from Jacob Bethell and Harry Brook propelled England to 184 for seven.

title: Police arrest ride operator, staff in Surajkund swing collapse case
content: Inspector Jagdish Prasad, 58, died while attempting to rescue those trapped in the swing, officials said. He had joined the Haryana Armed Police in 1989 and was scheduled to retire in March after completing 36 years of service. His body was handed over to his family on Sunday following a post-mortem examination.

title: Celina Jaitly on brother’s UAE detention: Actress says nobody supported her
content: Celina Jaitly has been seeking answers over the detention of her brother, Maj (retd.) Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, in the United Arab Emirates since September last year. The issue came to light for her at a time when she was dealing with a deeply troubled marriage and an ongoing domestic violence case against her husband, Peter Haag.

title: ‘Slender Bombardier’: Researchers identify new dragonfly species in Kerala’s farmlands
content: A new dragonfly species, Lyriothemis keralensis or the Slender Bombardier, has been identified in Kerala's coastal regions after a decade of research. Distinct from its relatives, this species prefers agricultural lands like plantations over forests. Its discovery highlights the need to expand conservation efforts beyond traditional forest areas, emphasizing human responsibility for protecting these unique microhabitats.

title: 'Is snatching your child's phone a crime?' Father of 3 minors opens up about Ghaziabad suicide
content: Three minor sisters died by suicide in Ghaziabad. Their father confiscated their phones due to their obsession with Korean dramas and games. The girls were reportedly depressed after losing access to online activities and friends. Authorities are investigating the tragic incident. The father expressed his grief and confusion over the events.

title: T20 World Cup: India vs Pakistan likely to go ahead after ICC, PCB talks
content: It is also learnt that Imran Khawaja and Mubashir Usmani, two ICC representatives, reached Lahore on Sunday morning.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink entry in Pakistan delayed over data security concerns
content: Starlink, owned by tech billionaire Elon Musk, is among five companies seeking approval to provide satellite-based internet services in Pakistan. However, officials say unresolved security considerations and broader geopolitical factors have slowed the clearance process. The report also cited the fallout between US President Donald Trump and Elon Musk as a factor being weighed by the Pakistani establishment.

title: Thailand elections: Vote counting under way after polls close in tight three-way contest
content: Thailand's general election saw a tight race between the progressive People's Party, populist Pheu Thai, and conservative Bhumjaithai. With no single party expected to win a majority, coalition-building is crucial for forming the next government. Voters cast ballots amidst economic concerns and nationalist sentiment, with a referendum on a new constitution also held.

title: Beggar spotted reading Sidney Sheldon while lying on footpath in a viral post: Who is he?
content: A photograph of a man reading a Sidney Sheldon novel while enjoying a beedi by the roadside in Mumbai went viral, sparking discussions on homelessness and inequality. While some admired his focus, others found the image upsetting, raising concerns about romanticizing hardship and the lack of urban support systems.

title: Derrick Henry steals Super Bowl 60 spotlight in Oikos ad with Kathryn Hahn
content: Derrick Henry may not be playing in Super Bowl 60, but he is still in the spotlight. The Ravens RB teams up with Kathryn Hahn in his first Super Bowl commercial for Oikos, pushing a stalled San Francisco cable car and selling a message of inner strength, adversity, and protein-fueled offseason work.

title: ‘Naxalism will be completely eradicated by March 31’: Shah after Raipur security review
content: Union home minister Amit Shah declared Naxalism will be eradicated by March 31, citing successful security operations, infrastructure development, and a strong surrender policy.  Reviewing anti-Naxal efforts in Raipur, Shah highlighted significant gains, including over 500 Naxalites killed and thousands arrested or surrendered in Chhattisgarh since January 2024, weakening the insurgency.

title: Drake places $1m bet on Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX vs Seahawks
content: Drake has put a big bet on the New England Patriots to win Super Bowl LX. The Patriots, led by coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Drake Maye, surprised many people with their turnaround season. They will take on the Seattle Seahawks, led by quarterback Sam Darnold. The championship game will be played on February 8, 2026.

title: 'EC should hoist BJP's flag': Akhilesh slams poll body over Form 7 'misuse'
content: ​​​​​Alleging a coalition between the BJP and the poll body, the former Uttar Pradesh CM said that Form 7 was being completed and printed at the locations where the Samajwadi Party had won, and "disturbances have occurred at many of them." The SP chief further alleged that BJP won the ​​Bihar election through use of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and is "trying" the same in poll-bound West Bengal.

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
content: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

title: When will U19 WC winner Vaibhav Sooryavanshi turn 15?
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, born on March 27, 2011, will turn 15 on March 27, 2026. Despite his record-breaking performances in U19 and domestic cricket, he cannot play senior international cricket yet due to the ICC’s minimum age rule of 15. He is also ineligible for future U19 World Cups due to BCCI rules. Once he turns 15, he will be eligible for India’s senior team, with huge expectations around him.

title: Kerala: Forest officials bust gang trying to sell tiger skin, claws, teeth; 7 held
content: Forest officials in Kerala's Kannur district arrested a seven-member gang and seized tiger skin, claws, and teeth. Acting on intelligence, the operation led to the recovery of the body parts from three suspects, with four more apprehended later. The investigation suggests a possible link to poachers in Karnataka.

title: India and Canada agree to shared workplan to guide bilateral cooperation on national security
content: The visit by National Security Advisor Ajit Doval was ahead of Canadian Prime Minister Mike Carney visit to India in March.

title: Kerala University V-C’s chamber vandalism: legal action sought against CPI(M) Syndicate members and SFI activists
content: Kerala University files a complaint with the State Police Chief that CPI(M)-affiliated Syndicate members and SFI activists staged a disruptive protest at the university.

title: Prashant Kishor launches Bihar Navnirman Yatra to rebuild Jan Suraaj
content: Under the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, the State Government transferred ₹10,000 each to 1.56 crore women in Bihar in multiple phases, with a major proportion receiving the funds before the polls

title: Defamatory post: CPI State secretary Binoy Viswam lodges complaint with Cyber Cell
content: Post reportedly uploaded by a person from Anchal allege that Viswam’s family members have British citizenship

title: Probe finds no lapses on part of Museum police in handling Maniyanpilla Raju mishap
content: The probe found that the police followed all prescribed procedures, including attempts to contact Maniyanpilla Raju and visit his residence, where neither he nor his car were found.

title: Controversy over election funding of Anto Antony rages
content: After MP admits to borrowing from Nedumparambil Credit Syndicate, his opponent in the 2019 LS poll Veena George asks whether he had disclose the receipt of this fund to the Election Commission.

title: Kerala govt. to launch Digi Kerala 2.0—the second phase of its digital literacy programme
content: This phase will focus on cyber security, AI awareness, training for using the Local Self-Government department’s K-SMART application, and digitisation of basic documents

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s dietary preferences become a subject of social media discussion
content: CPI leader C. Divakaran sparks debate by quipping that Pinarayi preferred pricey fish over the day’s common place catch

title: Linguistic, cultural markers could hold the key to caste enumeration method: Professor G.N. Devy
content: The scholar says not taking this opportunity of upcoming Census to separately enumerate Denotified Tribes (formerly ‘criminal’) could alienate more than 10 crore people.

title: India-Greece defence ties in focus as Ministers meet in New Delhi
content: India-Greece defence cooperation, Rajnath Singh-Nikos Dendias meeting, bilateral talks, Joint Services Staff Talks, maritime exercise

title: Bengaluru commuters, drivers push for early rollout of Bharat Taxi
content: The push for Bharat Taxi gained momentum after Amit Shah announced in December 2025 that the government planned to launch the app within ‘one or two months’ to reduce the dependency of commercial vehicle drivers on private companies

title: Tirumala laddu issue: Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar flays YSRCP’s denial of  wrongdoing
content: The YSRCP is backing those involved in the case despite the CBI making clear that adulteration has taken place, he says

title: Mayor orders crackdown on spas in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Cross massaging, the practice of women massaging for men and vice versa, will not be allowed, says Mayor V.V. Rajesh.

title: Exploration of beach sand minerals won’t threaten course of Nagavali, Vamsadhara rivers: Rammohan Naidu
content: The State government is yet to take a final call on the airport proposed earlier in Kakinada and Tuni, said Mr. Rammohan Naidu

title: Mahasivaratri Brahmotsavams begin at Srisailam temple
content: Special rituals held as per Agama Sastras; free laddu prasadam for devotees from February 13 to 16 and free bus services arranged during festivities

title: SIT exposed ‘false narratives’ on Tirumala laddu row, says YSRCP leader
content: The charge-sheet has made it clear that there is no evidence of animal fat in the ghee, claims Srinivasa Rao

title: Chennithala urges intellectuals to reconsider participation in Kerala govt. conference
content: In an open letter, the Congress leader warns that participation in the International Conference on Development and Democracy on February 15 in Thiruvananthapuram could be viewed as a political tool for the ruling government.

title: Enhanced vigil on Tirupati border ahead of TN general elections
content: The district shares a long border with Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district, featuring a network of national and State highways connecting the two States.

title: Maoism is being completely eradicated before March 31, says Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister appealed to Maoists to lay down their arms, saying the government doesn't want to fire a single bullet and will welcome those who surrender "with a red carpet"

title: Samastha calls for bifurcation of Malappuram, urges scientific review of boundaries of districts
content: Formation of new districts will bring civil stations, hospital and other infrastructure closer to people, while accelerating economic growth in backward regions, says resolution

title: India will stop importing fruits, vegetables, flowers: Union Minister Chouhan
content: The Union Minister for Rural Development, Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare noted that India had already made significant progress, calling current production levels "historic”.

title: Pedalling for a ‘greener Thrissur’ as cyclothon rolls through city at dawn
content: Nearly 100 cyclists take part in SAKSHAM 2025–26 awareness ride promoting fuel conservation and sustainable living

title: Food poisoning at tribal welfare hostel: Chief Minister Naidu directs action against staff, seeks report by February 9
content: He wants the health condition of the 92 students admitted to area hospitals in Maredumilli and Rampachodavaram to be monitored continuously and regular updates given to the CMO

title: Goal is to transform rural areas into tourism hubs: A.P. Tourism Minister
content: Kandula Durgesh says 110 videos shot by social media influencers have reached over 9 million people across the country, leading to over 1,000 booking inquiries made in the past one month alone

title: TDB Vigilance probes suspicious money transfers of daily wage workers at Sabarimala
content: Wages, at ₹650 a day, are deposited in the workers bank accounts after the pilgrimage season usually. This time, workers were found to have sent home large sums of money daily before the wages were disbursed. Officials suspect illegal earnings

title: Mystery continues to shroud PG medico’s death in Vijayawada GGH
content: A.P. Mahila Commission Chairperson Rayapati Sailaja asks investigating officers to find the reasons behind the ‘puncture marks’ on the body; we are waiting for the post mortem report, says GGH Superintendent A.Y. Rao

title: Then CMD and whole-time director of Amira Pure Foods declared ‘fugitive economic offenders’
content: Court orders the confiscation of movable and immovable assets worth ₹123.85 crore belonging to the accused under the Fugitive Economic Offenders Act

title: Barnwell’s annual Super Bowl opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Patriots and pick the winner
content: Can Drake Maye hit enough big plays? Which Sam Darnold will show up? And will defense define this Super Bowl matchup? Let's go deep on the big game.

title: Vonn, skiing on torn ACL, crashes at Olympics
content: Lindsey Vonn, racing on a badly injured left knee, crashed early in the Olympic downhill and was taken to safety by a rescue helicopter for the second time in nine days.

title: Fins, Cards seek trade partners for Tua, Kyler
content: The Dolphins and Cardinals will have challenges trading their starting quarterbacks -- Tua Tagovailoa and Kyler Murray, respectively -- because of financial hurdles.

title: Bettors back Seahawks in SB; books pull for Pats
content: The betting public is siding heavily with the favored Seahawks and its offensive playmakers against the Patriots in the Super Bowl.

title: Scheyer: Staff got 'punched' in UNC's court storm
content: Duke coach Jon Scheyer said he had staff members "that got punched in the face" as North Carolina fans stormed the court to celebrate a late winning shot in the famed rivalry.

title: Johnson wins downhill for USA's first Milan gold
content: American ski racer Breezy Johnson won the Olympic downhill with a hard-charging run on a day marred by teammate Lindsey Vonn's crash that saw her being taken off the mountain in a helicopter.

title: Premier chides protesters as 'enemies of Italy'
content: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni condemned recent anti-Olympics protests in Milan and alleged sabotage of train infrastructure, calling those responsible "enemies of Italy and Italians."

title: Sengun sorry for sexist remark at female official
content: Rockets center Alperen Sengun expressed remorse for calling a female referee a "b----" earlier this week and said he apologized to her after the game.

title: Russian figure skater spins new tune over rights
content: Russian figure skater Petr Gumennik has been forced to change his short program music two days before the men's program at the Milan Cortina Olympics after joining a growing list of figure skaters dealing with copyright issues.

title: 🐝 Latest NFL buzz from Super Bowl week
content: Here's what we heard this week in San Francisco on the Super Bowl teams, upcoming free agency, coaching moves and one intriguing trade candidate.

title: 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics: Lindsey Vonn crashes, Breezy Johnson wins downhill and more live updates from Sunday
content: The 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics continue. Follow along live with the top highlights from Sunday, which include women's downhill skiing, figure skating's team event and more.

title: Swami Sez: Chris Berman picks the winner of Super Bowl LX
content: Boomer has correctly picked the winner in five of the past seven years. Which preseason long shot is he picking Sunday?

title: Sixty bets for Super Bowl 60
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered and narrowed it down to our 60 from 10 different categories.

title: Bracketology: Saint Louis could be a real threat come March
content: The Billikens are an analytical unicorn -- and shaping up to be the Atlantic 10's next generational team.

title: Mike Vrabel's postgame ritual ignited Patriots' Super Bowl run
content: High-fives, headlocks and full sprints: This is how the former All-Pro linebacker molded the franchise in his image.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Mainoo embodies Man United's resurgence under Carrick in win vs. Spurs
content: Kobbie Mainoo looked on his way out of Manchester United as they struggled under Ruben Amorim. Now he's pivotal in their revival under Michael Carrick.

title: Arsenal stun Man City to boost their UWCL hopes and keep WSL title race alive
content: Arsenal's rejuvenated form since the turn of the year continued on Sunday with a 1-0 win over Women's Super League champions-elect Manchester City.

title: From Josh Howlin to Barker Playfield: NFL-inspired pups headline Puppy Bowl XXII
content: Before the Seahawks and Patriots clash in Super Bowl LX, Barker Playfield, Josh Howlin and more take the field for Puppy Bowl XXII, competing for the Lombarky Trophy and the title of "Most Pupular."

title: 'It's over. Guys are gone': What James Harden and the Clippers realized before the shocking trade
content: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

title: What NBA insiders are watching amid trade deadline aftermath
content: Tim Bontemps canvases the league after the deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: The best of the 2026 recruiting class, by position
content: How elite are the Nos. 1 and 2 recruits in the 2026 class? We analyze each position and break down who can be sleepers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to rival Man City for long-throw king Kayode
content: Manchester United and Newcastle have joined Manchester City in the race to sign Brentford wing back Michael Kayode. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Rajasthan Honeymoon Murder: They Met 7 Years Ago, Reconnected In 2024, Committed Murder A Year Later
content: The accused, 23-year-old Anjali, met 25-year-old Sanjay at a function where he was working as a waiter. While they exchanged words and he gave her his number, Anjali did not own a mobile phone at the time, and the two lost touch.

title: Iran Sentences Nobel Peace Laureate Narges Mohammadi To 6 Years In Jail
content: An Iranian court sentenced Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi to a six-year prison term, her lawyer told AFP on Sunday.

title: "Does Not Scare Us": Iran On US Military Deployment In The Region
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on Sunday ruled out Tehran ever giving up uranium enrichment in its negotiations with Washington, insisting it will not be intimidated by the threat of war with the United States.

title: "I Am Not On That Panel": Mohan Bhagwat On 'Delay' In Bharat Ratna To Savarkar
content: Mohan Bhagwat, the chief of BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, said today that if Bharat Ratna is conferred on VD Savarkar, the prestige of the award will increase.

title: 2 Arrested In Surajkund Fair Ride Collapse Case
content: The Haryana Police on Sunday said they have registered a case in the Surajkund joyride accident and arrested two persons, including the owner of the ride-operating company, on charges of lapses in ensuring safety.

title: "We Don't Expand Based On Caste, We Expand Geographically": RSS Chief
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday asserted that caste is not a determining factor in the selection of the organisation's Sarsanghchalak.

title: "Call To Genocide": Congress On Himanta Sarma's Now-Deleted 'Point-Blank' Video
content: A video that showed Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma appearing to shoot at framed photographs of Muslims, has drawn massive criticism from the Opposition, which termed it a "call to genocide".

title: Rekha Gupta Releases Rs 1,200 Crore For Delhi Transport Body Pensioners
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta approved a grant of Rs 1,200 crore for the DTC, providing major relief to thousands of serving employees and pensioners, while promoting technology infusion in the public transporter, an official said on Sunday.

title: Thumping Victory Projected For Japan PM Sanae Takaichi In Snap Elections
content: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi was projected Sunday to have won a thumping victory in snap elections, in a result that could however rile China and worry financial markets.

title: 32nd Avenue CEO Arrested In Rs 500-Crore Fraud. Sold 1 Building Floor To 25 People
content: Real estate entrepreneur Dhruv Dutt Sharma, founder and CEO of the commercial real estate project 32nd Avenue director of 32nd Milestone, has been arrested for allegedly selling a floor of a building to over 25 people.

title: The Shahbagh Movement: How Execution Of A Jamaat Leader Paralysed Bangladesh
content: It was 2013. Ten months before Jamaat-e-Islami leader Abdul Quader Mollah, convicted of war crimes, was executed, thousands gathered in the Shahbagh area of Dhaka.

title: Pilot, Trainee Injured As Private Aircraft Crashes In Karnataka
content: A trainer aircraft belonging to Red Bird Aviation crash-landed in Karnataka's Vijayapura district on Sunday, leaving the pilot and a trainee pilot injured.

title: When Sheikh Hasina Was Addressing A Rally And Grenades Started Exploding
content: Dhaka witnessed one of the deadliest attacks in the history of Bangladesh on August 21, 2004. A major grenade assault on then opposition leader and future Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's rally left 24 dead.

title: Pilkhana Massacre: Inside 2009 Bangladesh Rifles Mutiny That Bleeded Dhaka
content: Bangladesh General Election 2026: As Bangladesh prepares for next week's general election on February 12, here's everything you need to know about the 2009 paramilitary mutiny.

title: 2 Skiers Killed In "Large-Scale" Avalanche In French Alps
content: An avalanche has killed two off-piste ski tourers in the French Alps, a local prosecutor said on Sunday.

title: Himanta Sarma vs Gaurav Gogoi After Bombshell Report In Pak Links Case
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has targeted Gaurav Gogoi once again, as a special investigation team published a report on the probe into the Congress MP's alleged links to Pakistan.

title: Killing Of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman And Rise Of Military Politics In Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh was barely four years old when Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, the father of the nation, was assassinated on August 15, 1975.

title: AAP Accuses Haryana Government Of Halting Diet Allowance For 37,000 Athletes
content: Senior AAP leader Anurag Dhanda on Saturday accused the BJP government in Haryana of stopping about 37,000 players' diet allowance in the state for the past 10 months.

title: "Coercion Or Conviction": Sanjay Raut On Salman Khan's Presence At RSS Event
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut especially questioned the presence of actor Salman Khan at a recent Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh event.

title: Who makes Mike Macdonald's defense so good? Three Seahawks to watch in SB LX
content: the seahawks are on a more impressive Super Bowl run than the Patriots . the Seahawks have held opponents to 10 points or fewer five times . it's the biggest reason the Seattles won a club-record 14 games during the regular season .

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?

title: One-stop cheat sheet: Everything you need to know about Seahawks-Patriots
